newsitem.title: UK: Reuters says regrets UK buyback tax changes.
newsitem.headline: Reuters says regrets UK buyback tax changes.

text.p: International news and information organisation Reuters Holdings Plc said on Tuesday it regretted Chancellor of the Exchequer Kenneth Clarke's proposed amendments to the rules on tax credits on share buybacks.

Reuters said earlier it would ask shareholders to delay a decision on the company's plan to return 613 million stg via a share buyback and special dividend. "The Board regrets that the Chancellor's proposed amendments will appraently make it more difficult for UK companies to return cash to shareholders in a tax neutral way," it said in a statement.

The company added that, after considering the position of its U.S. shareholders, it has concluded that it can no longer rely on the clearance previously obtained from the UK tax authorities in respect of shareholders in the U.S.
U.S. shareholders comprise some 32 percent of of all Reuters shareholders.
The company said its current plan was designed to return cash within the constraints of Britain's existing advance corporation tax (ACT) system.

"Given the uncertainty created by the Chancellor's statement, the board believes it would be imprudent to proceed without details of the proposed legislation referred to in that statement," Reuters added, concluding that the company will continue to review the options available to it.
